intro: Piperia elongata subsp. michaelii, commonly known as Michael's piperia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. It is native to parts of North America, particularly in the eastern United States.
